text: French poster of the movie by Francisque Poulbot. The Two Boys (French: Les deux gosses) is a 1936 French drama film directed by Fernand Rivers. It is based on the 1880 novel of the same name by Pierre Decourcelle, which had previously been made into a silent film The Two Boys.Goble p.735 The film's sets were designed by Robert Gys. ==Cast== * Paul Barge * Rivers Cadet as Mulot * Lucienne Cauvières as Soeur Simplice * Dorville as La Limace * Annie Ducaux as Colette * Maurice Escande as Georges de Kerlor * Serge Grave as Claudinet * Jean Heuzé as Brisquet * Armand Lurville as Saint-Hyriex * Louise Marquet as Brigitte * Rolla Norman as Jacques d'Alboise * Marguerite Pierry as Zéphyrine * Augustine Prieur as Victoire * Rogers as Fadard * Germaine Rouer as Hélène de Kerlor * Robert Seller as Firmin * Marcel Seulin as Le petit Claude * Jacques Tavoli as Fanfan * Jean-Pierre Thisse as Le petit Jean == References == == Bibliography == * Goble, Alan.
